dt: {bc}to question or talk with (someone) to get information {bc}to conduct an {d_link|interview|interview:1} with (someone)

dt.t: Several strong candidates have been {wi}interviewed{/wi} for the position.
More than 60 staff members were {wi}interviewed{/wi} for the project …
Gone are the days when a language researcher had to {wi}interview{/wi} subjects in a lab …

dt: {bc}to participate in an interview for a position (such as a job)

dt.t: One warm morning I arrived to {wi}interview{/wi} for a job as an editorial assistant on a trade journal …

shortdef: to question or talk with (someone) to get information : to conduct an interview with (someone)
to participate in an interview for a position (such as a job)

dt: {bc}a formal consultation usually to evaluate qualifications (as of a prospective student or employee)
{bc}a meeting at which information is obtained (as by a reporter, television commentator, or pollster) from a person
{bc}a report or reproduction of information so obtained

et: Anglo-French {it}entreveue{/it} meeting, from ({it}s'{/it}){it}entreveer{/it} to see one another, meet, from {it}entre-{/it} inter- + {it}veer{/it} to see {ma}{mat|view|}{/ma}
shortdef: a formal consultation usually to evaluate qualifications (as of a prospective student or employee)
a meeting at which information is obtained (as by a reporter, television commentator, or pollster) from a person
a report or reproduction of information so obtained

dt.t: an actor who has stopped {it}giving/granting/doing interviews{/it}

dt: {bc}a preliminary meeting or conversation occurring prior to an {d_link|interview|interview:1}

dt.t: Sitting in my house while on the phone doing my {wi}preinterview{/wi} … I had what most people would call a breakdown.
In the {wi}pre-interview{/wi}, I would always outline exactly what I wanted to talk about and prepare carefully.

shortdef: a preliminary meeting or conversation occurring prior to an interview

dt.t: … in his {wi}self-interview{/wi}, {ldquo}Glenn Gould Interviews Glenn Gould About Glenn Gould,{rdquo} the pianist argues that the spectacle of the concert hall involves the celebration of an individual on stage …
